p: Overproduction of reactive oxygen species (ROS) is the major cause of oxidative stress. This phenomenon arises as a result of an imbalance between the level of ROS and the endogenous enzymatic antioxidants in the human body, and is followed by a series of health disorders, especially cancer, cardiovascular and liver diseases, and inflammation. ROS can oxidize the DNA base guanosine and thus induce point mutations [ 1, 2].
